weather_report:
As midnight fades into the early hours, Downtown San Francisco rests in a tranquil embrace of mostly clear skies. The temperature, a gentle reminder of winter’s chill, hovers around 48 degrees, caressed by a soft west-northwest breeze that whispers through the streets. This peaceful calm will yield to a sunny Thursday, with daytime highs cresting near 61, the warmth gradually washing over the city before retreating in the afternoon to a cooler 58. The north-northwest winds will continue to play their muted symphony, keeping the atmosphere crisp yet invigorating.

The clarity of the night beckons exploration; the ethereal glow of city lights reflects an energy that stirs the heart with possibilities. For those who delight in the subtle pulse of life around them, this is a perfect canvas to enjoy a pleasant walk along the Embarcadero or indulge in a quiet coffee at a local café. Dressing in layers is advisable—perhaps a fitted sweater under a light jacket—to accommodate the cooling evening that follows the day’s sunshine. The marine layer, often only a rumor in winter, seems to have given way to a fleeting clarity, inviting you to wander without the usual fog’s embrace. Embrace this ordinary beauty, for even the simplest activities can offer a remarkable richness on such a serene day.
